Spencer Clem

Developer | Entrepreneur | Innovator

About Me

I am a full stack software engineer with a passion for the UNIX world. I have worked in both the public and private sector developing a wide range of tools from simple web apps to designing and implementing distributed architectures for use in a production environment.

When I'm not coding, you can usually find me tinkering with or riding motorcycles.

Education

North Carolina State University

B.S. Computer Science, May 2015

Graduated Summa Cum Laude with a Minor in Business Administration. Completed courses from computer architecture and operating system design to web application development.

Work Experience

Novetta

Software EngineerSeptember 2014 - Present

Designed, developed, and deployed a distributed architecture framework. Dealt with petabytes of live streaming data and video. Built several web applications using Sencha ExtJS, Go, and Apache Cassandra. Met unique customer requirements with minimal turnaround time. Helped promote an agile development process with jenkins, github PR CI, unit tests, basalmiq mockups, git, and nightly builds.

IBM

Software Engineer InternMay 2014 - September 2014

Worked in IBM's mainframe division on the z/OS architecture. Developed black box testing framework against the Communications Server for the TCP/IP stack and VTAM/SNA protocols. Wrote Java code in eclipse using SVN for version control.

Prometheus Group

Software Engineer InternJanuary 2014 - May 2014

Responsible for maintaining software and handling technical debugging and analysis of proprietary SAP and in-house web applications. Directly customer facing.
